five_facet_mindfulness_survey_10.Description: I watch my feelings without getting lost in them.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_11.Description: I tell myself I shouldnt be feeling the way Im feeling.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_12.Description: I notice how foods and drinks affect my thoughts, bodily sensations, and emotions.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_13.Description: Its hard for me to find the words to describe what Im thinking.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_15.Description: I believe some of my thoughts are abnormal or bad and I shouldnt think that way.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_16.Description: I pay attention to sensations, such as the wind in my hair or sun on my face.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_17.Description: I have trouble thinking of the right words to express how I feel about things.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_18.Description: I make judgments about whether my thoughts are good or bad.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_19.Description: I find it difficult to stay focused on whats happening in the present.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_2.Description: When Im walking, I deliberately notice the sensations of my body moving.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_20.Description: When I have distressing thoughts or images, I step back and am aware of the thought or image without getting taken over by it.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_21.Description: I pay attention to sounds, such as clocks ticking, birds chirping, or cars passing.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_22.Description: In difficult situations, I can pause without immediately reacting.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_23.Description: When I have a sensation in my body, its difficult for me to describe it because I cant find the right words.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_24.Description: It seems I am running on automatic without much awareness of what Im doing.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_25.Description: When I have distressing thoughts or images, I feel calm soon after.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_26.Description: I tell myself that I shouldnt be thinking the way Im thinking.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_27.Description: I notice the smells and aromas of things.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_28.Description: Even when Im feeling terribly upset, I can find a way to put it into words.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_29.Description: I rush through activities without being really attentive to them.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_3.Description: Im good at finding words to describe my feelings.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_30.Description: When I have distressing thoughts or images I am able just to notice them without reacting.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_31.Description: I think some of my emotions are bad or inappropriate and I shouldnt feel them.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_32.Description: I notice visual elements in art or nature, such as colors, shapes, textures, or patterns of light and shadow.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_33.Description: My natural tendency is to put my experiences into words.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_34.Description: When I have distressing thoughts or images, I just notice them and let them go.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_35.Description: I do jobs or tasks automatically without being aware of what Im doing.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_36.Description: When I have distressing thoughts or images, I judge myself as good or bad, depending what the thought/image is about.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_37.Description: I pay attention to how my emotions affect my thoughts and behavior.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_38.Description: I can usually describe how I feel at the moment in considerable detail.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_39.Description: I find myself doing things without paying attention.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_4.Description: I criticize myself for having irrational or inappropriate emotions.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_40.Description: I disapprove of myself when I have irrational ideas.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_5.Description: I perceive my feelings and emotions without having to react to them.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_6.Description: When I do things, my mind wanders off and Im easily distracted.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_7.Description: When I take a shower or bath, I stay alert to the sensations of water on my body.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_8.Description: I can easily put my beliefs, opinions, and expectations into words.

five_facet_mindfulness_survey_9.Description: I dont pay attention to what Im doing because Im daydreaming, worrying, or otherwise distracted.
